definitions.definition: To protect ; to keep from harm or injury.
examples: Every people has the right to preserve its identity and culture.

definitions.definition: To save from decay by the use of some preservative substance, such as sugar or salt; to season and prepare (fruits, meat, etc.) for storage.
To maintain throughout; to keep intact.
examples: to preserve appearances; to preserve silence

main_definition: To protect ; to keep from harm or injury.
secondary_definitions: To save from decay by the use of some preservative substance, such as sugar or salt; to season and prepare (fruits, meat, etc.) for storage.
To maintain throughout; to keep intact.
